title.narrative: Technical Assistance For The Revision Of Angola's Building Code Ad National Urban Policy

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is two-fold: on one hand to provide UNICEF technical assistance for adapting INAC buildings according to international standards and UN Office Space Planning Guidelines, on the other to make this a practical exercise which will help to unfold the best strategy to review REGEU.As UNICEF will be relocated to a public building constructed according to REGEU requirements, this exercise in a unique opportunity to test standards and identify bottlenecks so that the revision of the building code will be more adapted to the local context while at the same time serving to showcase best practices.The revision of the Angolan building code is fundamental to unlock the self-build incremental housing component of Angola's Housing Programme. In this regard, it would benefit an important part of the Angolan population to fulfill their right to adequate housing, especially women given the number of households headed by females, the youth and the most vulnerable.The project will not only influence the regulatory framework to make building standards more affordable, it will also address specific issues such as the compulsiveness of upper water reservoirs that are fundamental for the maintenance of water supply in case of electricity shortages. Another example of specific issue that could be tackled through the revision is making the provision of parking obligatory for buildings with great impact in the neighbourhood to avoid the current car invasion in public spaces. In addition to specific changes such as the above mentioned, the revision will update a legislation from the 1970s to the current paradigms of resilience, sustainability, safety and inclusion.The identified partners to this project are: UNICEF, DNH (National Direction of Housing) DNOTU (National Direction of Urban and Territorial Planning, Ministry of Construction, IPGUL (Luanda's Institute of Urban Planning and Management) and the Municipal Administration of Luanda.UN Habitat will provide both knowledge services and high-level policy advisory throughout this project. The agency is providing knowledge services to UNICEF on architecture design for sustainability, resilience, safety and inclusiveness and high-level advisory services to DNH, DNOTU, the Ministry of Construction, IPGUL and the municipal administration of Luanda for the revision of REGEU.
